website_summaries.verdict: Design differs from others with a serrated jaw for a tighter grip on wider objects.
pros: Jaws open to 3 inches in width
Serrated jaw and foam rubber tip provides a stronger grip
Comfortable to use for extended periods of time
cons: Foam rubber tip may wear down quickly

customer_reviews.title: Bought this after having abdominal surgery. It was the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after having abdominal surgery. It was the recommendation of my OT therapist it was waiting for me when I came home it had been a heavenly tool. I bought two, else how do you pick up your dropped pick up tool?!
customer_reviews.author: Not_you

customer_reviews.title: Good quailty but different
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same brand as I received in the hospital because of the quality. I thought this would be exactly the same and it is not. 1-the flat black portion of the jaw is smooth and mine from the hospital is ridged which seems to work a little better. 2-it is longer than the one from hospital and being 5'1" makes it a little awkward for me to grab the object from the jaw. 3-the one from the hospital being shorter makes me have to bend my knees to pick something up off the floor so I thought the longer one would be better. In conclusion, they both have good and bad but both are good quality grabbers.
customer_reviews.author: SmilinHeart

customer_reviews.title: Handy grabber/reacher
customer_reviews.text: Super useful to grab all manner of household items that drop behind furniture, or just out of reach. I've had this handy tool available for many years, ever since my husband was disabled years ago. Not to be without. I gave a grabber to a friend who had surgery on her back and hip, then replaced my own, so I'd have it handy. Definitely a must-have for anyone with mobility or flexibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Calebini

customer_reviews.title: twigs and crap my customers leave lying around the yard
customer_reviews.text: I do lawncare for a living and use this to pick up limbs. twigs and crap my customers leave lying around the yard. Works well & is sturdy but lightweight. I have it mounted to the frame of my mower with clips so I just grab it & pick up stuff w/o having to stop & get off of the mower. Makes my job easier. It will even pick up medium sized rocks if you have the grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: evensteven

customer_reviews.title: Nice but get the longer one
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar grabber and love it so I ordered this for my daughter but did not realize the size difference. Mine is longer and I should have ordered the longer one (32") since the longer one is more useful with a longer reach. I use it often to pick up grandbaby's toys since he is at the stage of dropping things for fun. My daughter has a ball pit and she commented how she picks up 50 plastic balls every evening and would love my grabber.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: This item does NOT close all the way, so if you are trying to pick up a checkbook, a bill, or any other item that isn't at least 3/4ths of an inch in depth, look for a different product. This was a huge disappointment and I would return it if only I weren't physically incapacitated.
customer_reviews.author: Mather

customer_reviews.title: it is well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mainly to retrieve and hang garments in the closet. With the amount of weakness in my arm, it's a bit too long and heavy when it's fully loaded with a garment and then it becomes difficult to lift. A shorter reacher so that the garment wasn's so far away from my center of gravity, might improve the situation. Otherwise, it is well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the same one I used in rehab after back surgery. I needed this to dress myself and obviously reach for things as I was healing. I'm still using it.
customer_reviews.author: Janet W

customer_reviews.title: Not substantial for constant use.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item because I have issue with my hands. This grabber is extremely flimsy. It is not very well made. I doubt that it will endure daily use. I wish I had selected a more substantial item.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. F. W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: but it's a great tool just ordinarily
customer_reviews.text: Have a reacher because of surgery, but it's a great tool just ordinarily. One gets really good with it, like picking up a dime that you drop. For anyone who isn't permitted to lean over much, it's an absolute necessity.
customer_reviews.author: TAS

customer_reviews.title: I was delighted to get these reachers and they arrived so fast
customer_reviews.text: I was delighted to get these reachers and they arrived so fast. I wanted something simple and what i head before. Only problem with the two reachers I purchased they do not pick up the two endds that you push to gether do not touch or close. Do not waste your money. I cant return them beccause I dont haae the box sthey came in and are too long for any boxes I have. very disadppointed Dot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Have searched for one like this for years. This is the design I was given in hospital, simple but works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: r embler

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight, Gripper Does Not Open Wide Enough!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the grabber is 32in long, but it is very light weight. The grab part doesn’t open up wide enough to grab like a large jar of peanut butter. But it will grab a pill bottle just fine and smaller items. Because it is so lightweight it feels sort of cheap. I wouldn’t trust it to pick up anything heavy. I will be using it but it won’t be my favorite model.
customer_reviews.author: Moonstruc6

customer_reviews.title: Sammons Preston Rolyan Reacher - 26" is a great tool, my wife liked it so well
customer_reviews.text: Sammons Preston Rolyan Reacher - 26" is a great tool , my wife liked it so well, she had me look for a 32." Both 26" and 32" are sturdily made and we put them to task every day. I find the 26" model a bit too short, so I have to bend somewhat. The 32" model, I like better. I would recommend the 32" model to everyone, but the 26" model works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Col MMB

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Useful, pair with 2nd different grabber
customer_reviews.text: After a short period of use I am very pleased with the 26” Sammons Preston Reacher ($15.18). When sitting in a wheelchair I have used it to pick up papers on the floor, release 4 pound therapeutic ankle weights held by Velcro straps, and untie shoelaces. No negatives so far. I also bought a second grabber (32” Venus, $12.88, I also rate 5 star), and ordered together on Amazon it was free shipping. When one grabber falls on the floor, the other grabber can pick it up. This has happened to me several times.
customer_reviews.author: JonWex

customer_reviews.title: My grabber does not close completely. Makes picking up thin I don't difficult or impossible.
customer_reviews.text: Just had back surgery needed this item so I could pick things up that I dropped on the floor. Works very well except for thin items. The grabber does not close all the way It makes picking up thi n items very difficult Or impossible. Pic is with grabber handle Squeezed all the way closed. Great for picking up bigger items but no way are picking up something small. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Delinda

customer_reviews.title: I prefer RMS brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 reachers for my hip surgery. This model is OK for reaching very small objects, due to its precision ---small--- grip. But I learned through experience that I'm primarily reaching boxes, books, jars, and various medium/large items from tall shelves, and the RMS U-shaped gripping end is much more useful. If you need to reach a coin from under a washing machine, or if you use this tool to pull up your socks (I didn't, I used a hook tool for that), then the Sammons model may be preferable, but long after my surgery recovery, I'm preferring the RMS design.
customer_reviews.author: RiceMom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fold as claimed
customer_reviews.text: This is not very sturdy, which is why it's lightweight. Okay only for very light objects. The 4108 model is supposed to be folding. There are no instructions telling how to fold it, and I'm afraid it will break if I try to separate the two parts of the shaft. I would not recommend this model. Too late for me to return for refund, so it will get very little use. I'm very disappointed that there are no instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Paw Pal

customer_reviews.title: My favorite reacher
customer_reviews.text: As a disabled, retired occupational therapist, I have used many reachers. I date back to the days before they were commercially available and we had to make our own for our clients. This one is light weight, simple to use, relatively durable, though I have gone through several with hard use over the years. My husband, who is not disabled, keeps one outside to assist in the garden. I keep one in every room, from the laundry, to the dog room to the family room. I use one for a dressing aide and one in the kitchen. Without this reacher, I would be”handicapped”, not simply disabled.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Aid for Saving my Back
customer_reviews.text: This is not the first grabber I've had. The others are still in use: I keep each one in the room where it will be used most often, such as the bathroom. This new one I bought to use in my sunroom, where I tend all my indoor plants. The grabber–which is bright red to distinguish it from the other two–is handy for picking up fallen leaves or small branches, or wiping the tile floor dry with a paper towel. I was concerned that it might not be as functional as the two I already owned, but it works just as well. I think no home is complete without a grabber in every room, not forgetting the ktitchen. '
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: my fault, I did not think when I ordered, do not want 2 piece folding
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace one my daughter had said she got at Amazon. So, since I have no live, and just finger thru catalogs, and buy things I will only have another couple years, before I croak, since 71, already. This grabber, might be ok for some, but the one I had was 0ne piece, with a post near the gripping end, on top. I think it held in a magnet as well, which this does not have, and hard to pick up silverware, without, and the post was good to hook clothing, and pull things backwards to retrieve, as doing that with this grabber, pulls it apart. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: Philip O.

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to be expandable but I never could figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to be expandable but I never could figure out how to expand it. When I emailed seller they failed to explain it to me
customer_reviews.author: C. Wells

customer_reviews.title: You need this if you can't bend over
customer_reviews.text: After back surgery on July 28 I was ordered NOT TO BEND OVER. Yes, Dr put that in caps. I have been a good girl obedient to the letter. I got one of these based on some back surgery blog. So glad I did, as I have used it very often. My only problem is leaving it in one room and needing it elsewhere! It will pick up little pieces of paper, plastic, pens, socks, but not big bunches of cat hair. It won't pick up the cat, either. Not sure why I was asked to rate its suction power. Grab power tho is fairly good. Have recommended it to several people. A very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Doc W8

customer_reviews.title: False advertising... reversed
customer_reviews.text: I initially rated this reacher 1 stare because it was advertised as "folding" but the reacher did not come with instructions, I couldn't figure out how to do it, and I couldn't find support to show me how to fold it. :-( But I persevered and kept looking for support and FINALLY found someone at Sammons Preston and after 20 minutes of them searching for an answer... they were able to tell me how to fold the reacher... Hold onto the shaft of the reacher with one had on each side of the middle metal piece and pull. It worked! And now you know too!
customer_reviews.author: jamurphy

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you want to use it for. . .
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget will pick up the tiniest of items with ease (such as tiny pieces of paper, a paper clip, coin, necklace chain, etc.) It’s lightweight, and I put a zip tie through the hole in the handle so I can hang it on my rolling walker. I’ve found I still have a need for my clunkier large gripper/reacher to pick up larger items like cans and bottles. This Sammons Preston gripper/reacher will not accommodate large items. I’m glad I have both, but I use the Sammons the most.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy and OliverTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Product durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item at the end of October prior to my spinal surgery on 11/11/19. I loved the item for the first 3 weeks but noticed that it was no longer able to pick up small items. Upon looking further, I noticed that the rubber tip on the grabber wore off after only limited use within 3 weeks after I began using it. There does not seem to be a way to request a replacement item since it was purchased over 30 days ago. I would appreciate the manufacturer contacting me if, under the circumstances, I can replace or return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela K. Squires

customer_reviews.title: My aunt uses it every day --
customer_reviews.text: My disabled aunt loves this grabber. She can only use one hand and is in a wheelchair. She uses it everyday!! Seems well made, easy to use and is longer than many others.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grabbing tool for those who can’t bend over to retrieve things.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grabber ahead of my scheduled spine surgery. It has been a life saver. I keep it on my bed and take it everywhere I go. It has the ability to grab heavy items, clothing, my cell phone, remote controls but also works perfectly on small things like pills I have dropped, even lint on the floor. I discovered today it had a magnet on the end. I am extremely happy with this item and would highly recommend it. If I have any complaints it would be I wish it was an inch or two taller.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S. Finn

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Table Puller / Pusher
customer_reviews.text: I use this reacher for so many things. Thing 1: using the small black screw-in protrusion on top, I pull my coffee table up close to me when I'm sitting on the couch. It's not as easy pushing it back but I do it using my cloth napkin to protect the furniture finish. Update 1/30/19: I now have 4 of these reachers. I still love them. They have not broken. They get used a lot. They hang from the hook but they have a hole that I could put something through like a cord or a J-hook that would make them hang even better.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lund

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for using if you have trouble picking things up or reaching things, It has a small magnet on the bottom as well. I use to put on socks or help pull up my pants while recovering from back surgery. It takes a short while to get used to the way you have to use it but it is a great item to have. Amazon was not only comparable in price but I couldn't go out to purchase it so delivery made it worth it. I buy everything from Amazon that I can anyway!
customer_reviews.author: S. Runyon

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I'd recently bought a Reacher Grabber that was a huge disappointment; not only could it not pick up small items, it proved ineffectual when I tried to lift wet clothes from my washer. So I went looking for the type of tool I'd had in the past and found this one. it works very well, will pick up a pen or a remote control and yes, it handles wet clothes too. It comes in several lengths for convenience and in different colors. I am very glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Better for Longer Fingers
customer_reviews.text: So far so good; it's set up with a cord for the lever action (which should last longer than ones rigged up with rubber bands). Does an adequate job for pick ups, but the distance between the handle when settled on your palm and the trigger is awkwardly far! I wind up using my middle finger to hook the trigger instead of my index because otherwise I can't reach to work it. My index is about 2" long and my middle's 3", so be warned short-fingered folk!
customer_reviews.author: tinadrawsstuff

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This reacher came in handy for me. I just had back surgery so I can't bend and I swear I feel like I am constantly dropping things on the floor now, so this is where this handy reacher came into play. The reacher is about 2ft long and it can pick up just about anything. I've used this help me get clothes out the dryer and everything I've dropped on the floor. Definitely would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Becka

customer_reviews.title: Handle too tiny
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these and they came today. I think they are as described. Sturdy, well made etc. I instantly was disappointed however that handles are so little, thin, and at a weird angle. My average size man hands finds it difficult to hold onto the tiny handle and pull the lever and pick up whatever item. I also realize at 32” it’s s too short. Should be a minimum of 36”. I will not return these, but I will also find myself a larger one that’s easier to hold onto. Maybe give these away to a tiny person.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Could Not Make it Without This Product
customer_reviews.text: I have now ordered four of these grabbers. I have them all over my house and even one in our van. It is very difficult for me to bend over, with a bad back. These are a life savor for me. Welll worth the money. They can pick up the smallest things, like a baby aspirin. A friend cam to visit and saw how it works and wanted one also. I gave her mine and ordered another one. This one came in blue and matches my walker. LOVE this grabber. Everyone should GRAB one!
customer_reviews.author: lynn T.

customer_reviews.title: Looks low tech. But!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've got them all over the place living room, bedroom, kitchen, and bathroom. Different lengths and colors. I purchasd a different style one, you know the one with the double moving pincers, and its not near as strong, no magnet and that post that's call clothing hook. You don't realize how much you use them, until you don't have them. And if it didn't come with a little piece of rubber tubing on the end of the pincer, get it you pick up anything with that on there even a dime lying flat. In my header I wrote " Looks low tech. But!!!" IT GETS THE JOB DONE.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A big help after an accident
customer_reviews.text: I bought the lightweight red long grabber. I’m barely 5ft but the short one was sold out. I don’t regret getting the longer one. I was able to reach clothes that fell behind my dryer with it. The magnet came in handy when I dropped a screw. It has a good solid grip for such a lightweight device and so far I haven’t had any problem picking up things I need.
customer_reviews.author: CyndeeZ

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother because her previous heavy duty reacher broke after 7 years. She got the last one through doctor Leonard’s and had no complaints, but relies pretty heavily on it, so we needed a replacement ASAP. The delivery was quick and the product is exactly what she needed. Fingers crossed this one lasts at least another 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: ARC2013

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: After multiple anticipated delivery dates and a not-so-prime delivery I opened the package and discovered it was not what pictured. Instead of a folding reacher as pictured it was a stationary reacher like the one I had just purchased for $3.00 less. I ordered it because I thought it would useful when traveling. I have bent several when placing in duffels. Big disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have a color choice
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a number of these in my life and given them to others. They are more durable then most. I really like these blue ones because some people perceive it to look less like a piece of medical equipment compared to the silver ones and are more willing to try them. Also there is a hole in the handle grip plenty big enough to run a ribbon, cord, or strap through and wear it on the wrist when out, rather than needing to always hold onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Why

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool. I use it to retrieve wet laundry ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool. I use it to retrieve wet laundry from the bottom of the washing machine. If it can't pull up the heavy laundry, I use the straight hook to pull it up to grab it. Works great also to retrieve laundry from the drier. I don't use it to retrieve glasses or cups from a higher shelf, for those items I use a heavier reacher that has suction cups. I highly recommend the Sammons Preston Reacher.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Louisa T.

customer_reviews.title: A very reliable reacher
customer_reviews.text: My wife has used A Sammons Preston reacher for several years, and it is still working great. She received it 20 years ago when she had her first hip surgery. Because of unexpected infection after a recent hip revision and almost two years of fighting it, she doesn't have a right hip and uses a walker to walk. I ordered two more for her to have handy in the bathroom and bedroom. I knew what the product was like and the new ones are just the same in quality and function. If you want a reliable reacher, I don't think you will find any problems with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get one before you need it
customer_reviews.text: Since it is not that expensive and will certainly go up in prcie as have a lot of these helpful instruments for elderly, buy it because it has the rubber feature for picking up stuff. I only used it because of a back problem that was temporary, but it will have future use. It should be there for you when a sudden need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sampson

customer_reviews.title: A HELPING HAND
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift because I already have one I received as a gift. Arthritis, bursitis, bad back, limited bending over - this thing is a real helping hand. I limit heavy cans or using it for anything over my head; but, there are plenty of other things to use it for and spare the pain. If I lose mine or break it, or if another family member or friend can use one, I will quickly order another one with no hesitation. Great for the price, too.
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for travelling. It did precisely what it was supposed to do. I am glad to own it. However, it is constantly coming apart when doing its job (this is more annoying than anything else). Also most reachers have a one inch thing sticking out of the bottom to help pull and grasp; this item does not have that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Gumbinner

customer_reviews.title: Hip hip away !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for anybody that had a hip replacement !!!helps you pickup things from the floor !! Also helps me put my pants on !! This is a must !!! Love it !!!!
customer_reviews.author: ralphderosa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect after hip surgery
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use after hip surgery, since I spend a good amount of time by myself. The occupational therapist recommended it to use in dressing. It’s able to pick up pieces of paper, slippers, even my iPad when it tumbled to the floor. Great item. Think it will also be useful around the house even after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Verocindy

customer_reviews.title: The best thing since potato chips!
customer_reviews.text: This is so wonderful to have especially if you're confined to a wheelchair! I now have a grabber (what I call it) in almost every room in our house! I have a tendency to be forgetful and take the grabber from room to room and leave it there. I now have 5 and am ordering another! They are an amazing invention and have been a big help to me.
customer_reviews.author: ARP in GC

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: My 87 year old father has one of these. He has a bad hip and cannot live without this reacher. He has had others but this one is the best. It picks up tiny items and the magnet on the bottom can pick up screws, nails, or anything metal like a paper clip! Wonderful product. Bought one for myself and it is indispensable for getting things down out of a cabinet or picking something up. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: NonaB

customer_reviews.title: " and this is by far the best. I received the first one from the hospital ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of different "grabbers," and this is by far the best. I received the first one from the hospital when my hip was replaced in 2011, and still use it to this day. It is sturdy with a strong and secure grip on objects. The only thing lacking is the ability to lock and hold something, but I have found NO grabber that actually does that well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: It has been a lifesaver I'm a quadriplegic feels like I have more Independence oh and I love it has a magnet to avoid something small that is metal that is on the floor I don't have to worry about it damaging my wheelchair for the floor if I run over it I cannot pick it up with the traditional grabber
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Having had to use these devices for the last 15 years, there is a great difference in the quality of these devices. The S/P grabber is by far the best. Given to me by several rehab facilities I have been at. I keep one in just about every room in home. I got this folding model to keep in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Reacher for the invalid
customer_reviews.text: I bought two more of these reachers. They come in so handy I don't know how I managed without them all this time. We have one in the kitchen, one in the Den where my husband is laid-up and one in the bedroom. Its like you now have a hand two feet longer. Far superior to those other type of suction cup things or clip hooks.
customer_reviews.author: JEG

customer_reviews.title: Handle is hard plastic and can be broken by rolling over it in a wheelchair.
customer_reviews.text: I am a prime member of Amazon and this (reacher is just as described. The magnet is what physicists call a rare earth alloy magnet and can pick up magnetic steel or iron pieces that are as much as 1/2 pound. The atomic elements called rare earth elements are extremely reactive. These elements have incomplete f-She’ll electronic configurations. Thus they can be polarized in a high spin state. That is why they are such good strong magnets. I’m A PhD physicist retired but still aClive. My office is at NC State University io Raleigh NC
customer_reviews.author: Jack Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Poor value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a good value. Walmart has the same thing for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burt

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I noticed that the moving “finger” for grabbing things is not sturdy to sideways pressure. It will turn sideways and I have to restraighten it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: It gets my mail without me having to get out if the car. I think it's good. There's others that are sturdier but they cost 4 times the money. Need something sturdier pay a lot more and you'll get it but its limited no matter how sturdy it wont pick up really heavy items. It's not designed for that.
customer_reviews.author: hope

customer_reviews.title: ... different brands of grabbers and Sammons Preston is the best. The others lose their tight closing action and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used many different brands of grabbers and Sammons Preston is the best. The others lose their tight closing action and you can't pick up thin objects between the teeth. This grabber hold it tightness. Best brand out there.
customer_reviews.author: n815

customer_reviews.title: Get it - you will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Have this particular item/brand when I was volunteering at a shop. Picks up even coins. A bit hard to get a single sheet of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jo

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Richard, the very best one I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Are use the reacher quite often in fact every day it is nice and sturdy I have the shorter one and I also have a longer one and they both are fabulous the shorter one I use for or if I drop something on the floor and cannot reach it I use the longer one for reaching higher up into the cupboards when I need something so this product is well worth every cent and I will continue to buy them I would like one for every room
customer_reviews.author: chayce campbell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a shot-in-the-dark as I've never had to use a gripping tool before. It is perfect for my needs, and it even has a magnet on the tip-- a nice addition. Well-built, priced right, easy to use. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reacher 26 " perfect for dressing
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I was issued one of these after spinal fusion surgery and it had over time quit working. I have many other reachers for picking things up off floor. But none are made right or short enough to use for dressing , pulling up pants etc. it is not heavy duty so not made for picking up heavy items. I tried replacing mine at the local medical supply store , had to buy a longer one it was too awkward the length of it. This is the same company that made the one I was given at the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Blue reacher!
customer_reviews.text: This is better than the average one you can buy at home health care. It’s more sturdy and it’s blue not the metal color of all other reacher sticks as my hubby calls it! He really likes this one and we would purchase again when he needs a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Young-Cronister

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: This grabber has the one feature I need the most: a magnetized tip ! I'm a quiltmaker and seamstress and always have pins on the rug - a quick sweep with the grabber and all my lost pins aren't available to stick my feet any more! Good feature!
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Not as long as I would like
customer_reviews.text: I also have the 'reacher' that has suction cups (ASIN: B00O47ILVA) - I use it most of the time, because of its 32" length and configuration. But I use this one occasionally because of its rigidity. I would give it five stars if it were longer.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good reacher; poor workmanship. Update added
customer_reviews.text: Because i had to learn to do everything again after a stroke, I use this product for most things. It helps putting clothes on, picking things up (even small pills), etc. Problem is I have to keep replacing them because it always comes apart after a couple of months. The screw on top loosens and falls off and the black insert that holds the string comes out. I am not at all hard on this reacher. It's annoying. Update: So far I have purchased about six of these with ssme problem. Going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jacapri

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Used it for a day to pick up paper scraps and the cord snapped. Had to take the whole thing apart and buy a new cord and restring it. It took a while to find the right place to tie it off the knot so the clamp works properly. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Morales

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: The handle is just a bit small for my liking. I think men would definitely find it too small. And, when you try to pick up something on the heavier side, the tongs will slip off the item and get stuck in a closed position that you can't open using the handle, which I find somewhat annoying. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AJ54

customer_reviews.title: very light-weight, but limited
customer_reviews.text: If you need a very small, lightweight reacher to pick up small objects, this may be for you. It does not open wide enough (about 3 inches?) for larger items. Also limited in weight of items. Seems well built. If it suits your particular need, get it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Temple

customer_reviews.title: There were no instructions on how to fold it and ...
customer_reviews.text: There were no instructions on how to fold it and I couldn't figure it out. I'm only 66 and I can usually figure things out even without the directions but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: n815

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Lightweight, Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just had a hip replacement and when something falls on the floor it stays there until husband gave pick it up. Not anymore! Excellent tool. I use it to put on clothes, shoes and pick up things I drop. Seems well made and very light
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I have one of these in every room
customer_reviews.text: These are great if you can't bend over or stoop to reach high or dropped objects. It has a hook, a grabber, a magnet and you can order different lengths.
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Full Featured Grabber
customer_reviews.text: Just got out of a convalescent hospital and this is the exact same grabber the physical therapists used there. This is easy for anyone to use and even has a magnet on the end for coins, etc. It can be used to help get dressed/undressed for disabled/partially disable/recovering from surgery folks. For me, I'm short, so I can use to grab things on top shelves and to grab that laundry that invariably falls behind or between the washer/dryer! Price point was a bargain considering all it does. Arrived well-packaged and on time. I couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Steichen

customer_reviews.title: Reach for the Sky
customer_reviews.text: This is the one to get. This company produces the best quality reachers. Great for getting things from the cupboard, and picking up things that you have dropped on the floor. . I also use mine for getting clothes out of the washer and dryer. The reason that I only gave it 4 stars is because the magnet on these is quite weak. I have an older one from them that has a much stronger magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Lanore

customer_reviews.title: My Least Favorite Grabber Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my handicapped brother but I also use it to get boxes off high shelves. This grabber doesn't open as wide as the others I have gotten and doesn't clasp as well. My brother said he only wants me to buy ones that open equally in both directions.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous ConsumerTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Good grabber
customer_reviews.text: One of the best grabbers I’ve used. Most of the others don’t have enough gripping strength to pick up more than a piece of paper. I’ve picked up a box of tissues, my cellphone, towels, etc. Definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: JLGL

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Very very cheap material. I actually bought two and I am pretty sure that I am sending them back. No where near the sturdiness or quality that they were when I bought one in the past. I am beyond disappointed in this product. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: BigChris

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight nice reacher gripper
customer_reviews.text: I gave it to five star on the suction power but it has no suction power, it has grip power which for a lightweight stick is pretty good. This is the same tool my occupational therapist uses. It has worked well for everything I need it for so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous Sammons reacher
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not the same quality as my other Sammon’s Preston reacher of the exact same model. The magnet is really weak, and it doesn’t pickup so many small items (that my other one had no problem with).
customer_reviews.author: Nocturnal Creature

customer_reviews.title: Can even pick up tiny objects.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an extra for my elderly mother. She likes to have several scattered around the house. I was impressed with how well she could use this to pick up objects of all sizes and shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Runcible Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Very strong hold, love the magnetic tip, with a loop in handle can hang on hook.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold and has a rubber grabber that helps pick up slippery things. Also the magnet at tip picks up my bobby pins off the floor or papers clips. There is no suction power but 5 stars for the grasping hold.
customer_reviews.author: 30donnam

customer_reviews.title: Work Fine. Have them everywherer I may sit down and need one. Great for Laundry.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these before. I have them everywhere: buy the bath sink, in the kitchen, buy every chair that I might sit in, by my desk, by the kitchen desk chair, in the laundry room. So much easier than bending over to pick up every little thing that falls. They work great for me. Note:I made the mistake of buying some longer ones and they were more in the way than helpful.
customer_reviews.author: N W.

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS ON LIGHT THINGS
customer_reviews.text: ITS NOT REALLY STRONG BUT WORKS PICKING UP LIGHTER THINGS. MY HUSBAND IS DISABLED AND WANTED TO PICK UP SMALL TWIGS OFF THE TREES WITHOUT BENDING OVER. IT DID NOT WORK WELL FOR EVEN TINY TWIGS.
customer_reviews.author: NY reader

customer_reviews.title: Simple, light-duty, well-made, and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, well-made, and it works. Lightweight (8 oz.), NOT heavy duty. This is not for cleaning up the side of the road! It's for helping an elderly or disabled person pick up something lightweight that he dropped or she can't reach. Just gives them a little more independence. Highly recommended if you understand what it's for and what it's not for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in TexasTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works great since my husband is recovering from hip replacement surgery. It's a 'slow' snap for putting on underwear and shorts!! Our Grandson enjoys it too!!! HJAHAHAHA
customer_reviews.author: Susan Irving

customer_reviews.title: The over all quality just isn't there
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this device is OK. However the actual "grabber" is less than desired. Not good at picking up small objects (coins, pens, small bottles). The handle feels awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: Helpful grabber
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for picking up things off the floor after my hip surgery. I had an old sammons grabber from over 20 years ago but I stretched out the string part. So it was time for a replacement. The new one is good, not as sturdy as the old version, but is working great.
customer_reviews.author: J K

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: Thought I had lost my previous one during Hurricane Florence. But found it in the storage pod once it was unloaded. So now have 2--one in the pantry and one in the bedroom. Had another different type one and it didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight grabber
customer_reviews.text: It's light, it grabs things without me having to bend down, and it has a magnet. I would like it to be just a little longer, because I have long arms. But it's excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Besa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Grip
customer_reviews.text: We do a bit of trash pick up and have a hard time finding a decent grabber. A lot of the ones we have had previously have had their strings break. This one has done great and it doesn't break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Saves a lot of frustrations!!
customer_reviews.text: When something falls to the floor... this save you from BENDING WAY OVER to pick it up... Works great for getting cans & jars off of shelves too! We have several all around the house so we have one when we NEED one!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lyddon

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Sorta small ,light weight with magnet & hook on end.Has a cable inside the rod that got stuck once picking up a 16 oz water bottle but came unstuck .Its well made.I use it to pick up clothes socks in bedroom.I like it.
customer_reviews.author: mgd

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband to use while recovering from total hip replacement. Used one week and it can no longer grab things. The cord inside has stretched too much. Do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Atmmom

customer_reviews.title: 32 inch long not well-balanced. 26 inch worthless ..maybe from different company , but they look identical
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, not sure which company was which, so we'll be posting same review on the other site as well. When I purchased was 32 inches long which was just too long for me but it doesn't seem to have good balance. I went back in and ordered another one from I don't know which company but 26 inches in size which is much better but frankly the Claw is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Shop by necessity

customer_reviews.title: Shorter and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: grabs softer items very well. The magnet on the tip is great! I had been using a different make with the "suction cups" on the ends and a hinge int he middle -- this is much sturdier. It is shorter which means I don't have to strain to take something in my hand from the reacher.
customer_reviews.author: Zia King

customer_reviews.title: Very weak magnet compaired to older units.
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received was a Chinese import and has a very weak magnet unlike the other rolyan reachers I have previously purchased. I like to hang the reacher from a bedside lamp swag chain; This can no longer be accomplished because of the weak magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The tip is flat instead of ribbed, makes it to hold on to anything that provides any resistance
customer_reviews.author: ronald meade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and more useful than the suction cup type
customer_reviews.text: I rated this 5 stars for suction even though it does not have suction cups, but rather a pincher claw. It also has a little hook and a magnet on the end so overall it's more useful for grabbing things out of reach than the suction cup scissor mechanism type. If you have stiffness/arthritis and trouble bending over or reaching for things this little tool will quickly become a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Springs Farm

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic, not for grabbing valuable items off the top shelf but perfect if you happen to break your leg (!) and need to pick up things that fall off the bed. Ask me how I know this.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: GOOD GRABBER
customer_reviews.text: I like this grabber! It's just the right length to reach into my washing machine to pull clothes out to put into the dryer. I'm a short person and this item is a lifesaver for me. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Linda Carlson

product_meta.title: Sammons Preston Reacher, Standard, 26", Grabber Reacher Tool, Lightweight Trash Picker Grabber & Garden Nabber, Handy Aluminum Picker Up Tool & Reaching Claw, Portable Reaching Assist & Dressing Tool
product_meta.description:
Size:26" StandardFor over 50 years, Sammons Preston has been the premier brand in aids to daily living and homecare devices. Sammons Preston products are adaptive living aids that help people cope with their environment. Whether you are a therapist or patient, someone with special needs, or just have a need to make life easier and more accessible, Sammons Preston products can help you. Occupational therapists, physical therapists, nurses, and other healthcare professionals rely on Sammons Preston adaptive utensils, adaptive plates and silverware, nosey cups, reachers and grabbers, grab bars, sock pullers, shoe horns, dressing sticks, hip kits, leg lifters, back scrubbers, gait belts, wheelchair belts, trays, and wheelchair accessories. These are the same high quality professional products used in hospitals, clinics, and nursing homes.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Not Applicable
feature_bullets: Standard reacher features a 26" long handle, flexible foam rubber tip to conform to objects and ensure a firm grip plus a magnetic tip
Jaws open to 3" wide, claw tool firmly and securely holds objects weighing 1 pound or less, with a pulling lug that helps draw items toward the user
Comfortable, ergonomically-designed trigger action handle makes a great trash pickup, garden nabber, lightbulb remover, and wheelchair tool
Non latex pickup tool is lightweight and easy to hold at just 6 oz. and features a ergonomic, trigger-action handle for improved grip
High quality durable aluminum promotes prolonged reliable use for those with limited reach, ideal for disabled and elderly living independently

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
